p: Viral tropism is defined as the capacity of a virus to infect specific cells, tissues, and species. It depends on both viral and cellular characteristicsâ€”with the presence of the cognate receptors for viral attachment molecules being of undeniable importance [ 83]. The CHIKV protein that facilitates cell binding is the E2 glycoprotein, while the related cellular receptor/s crucial for CHIKV entry has/have yet to be recognized [ 83]. Given the large tropism of CHIKV, its putative receptor/s is likely ubiquitously expressed among species and cell types [ 83].
